ISSUE.TITLE: Commented out and ignored tests which can easily be reapplied
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: nopCommerce version: 4.2 beta The following **commented** tests exist in nopcommerce which can be uncommented: **Nop.Web.MVC.Tests/Public/Validators/Blogs/BlogPostValidatorTests.cs:** `Should_have_error_when_comment_is_null_or_empty()` `Should_not_have_error_when_comment_is_specified()` Both of these tests are commented out with the note "uncomment tests when the following FluentVlidation issue is fixed http://fluentvalidation.codeplex.com/workitem/7095" The link does not work but if I uncomment the tests (and add appropriate using statements) they pass so these should be added back. **Nop.Web.MVC.Tests/Public/Validators/Catalog/ProductReviewsValidatorTests.cs:** `Should_have_error_when_title_is_null_or_empty()` `Should_not_have_error_when_title_is_specified()` `Should_have_error_when_reviewText_is_null_or_empty()` `Should_not_have_error_when_reviewText_is_specified()` Again, these have the same fluentvalidation comment as above and if I uncomment the tests (and add appropriate usings) they pass so these should be added back. The following **ignored** tests exist in nopcommerce: **Nop.Services.Tests/Messages/NewsLetterSubscriptionServiceTests.cs:** `VerifyInsertEventIsFired()` This test was commented out as you cannot test that `EventPublisherExtensions.EntityInserted` is called as this is an extension method. However, this extension method is simply a wrapper around `EventPublish.Publish` which you can test is called. I believe this test should be changed to test the `EventPublish.Publish` method is called instead. Otherwise, the test should be removed.
